info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 11:47PM CDT until June 30 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas, Ozark and Wright.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 PM CDT, The Missouri Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rainfall in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Pond Fork at County Road 883 and Little North Fork River at County Road 916. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Cabool, Mansfield, Alton, Gainesville, Norwood, Bakersfield, Pomona, Theodosia, South Fork, Koshkonong, Pontiac, Brandsville, Wasola, Thomasville, Sundown, Siloam Springs, Pottersville, Dora, Caulfield, Sycamore, Drury, Vanzant, Zanoni, White Church, Gentryville, Moody, Tecumseh, Udall, Rockbridge, Brixey, Peace Valley, Clear Springs, Hardenville and Lanton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT MONDAY

area.areaDesc: Douglas, MO; Howell, MO; Oregon, MO; Ozark, MO; Texas, MO; Wright, MO
